medical_history.chief_complaint: Short stature and growth failure in children born small for gestational age (SGA).
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Both patients presented with pre- and postnatal growth failure, with symptoms beginning at birth. Patient 1 showed poor appetite and feeding difficulties during her first year. Growth remained below the -2.5 SD score despite GH treatment initiated at around 5 years of age. Patient 2 experienced intrauterine growth retardation, and by age 4 years had persistent short stature and gastroesophageal reflux. Both patients showed changes in dysmorphic features over time.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Both patients had a history of short stature after SGA birth and were diagnosed with conditions initially resembling Silver Russell syndrome. Other medical histories include feeding difficulties in both patients and perinatal toxoplasmosis in Patient 2.
